answers.answer: Ugh, so sorry to read your history with the yeast infection.  Good gosh that is a lot of yeast infections!  Now, I always think running things by a doctor IS helpful.  Doctors are pretty good these days about incorporating natural remedies into what they tell you to do.   So, maybe a pelvic wouldn't be a bad idea especially if you haven't had one in years.I am not sure what is going on with the ph situation in your vagina.  It sounds like you are doing all the right things.  I assume you are taking a probiotic.  I assume you never ever douche.  You wear loose undies made of cotton and change them when they get sweaty.So, I have no idea if any of these things work but there was a girl here for a long time whose passion was naturally treating yeast infections.  Some of her ideas seemed out there but she said they worked.  I have NO experience with any of these so take them for what they are worth.  She treated herself with lemon juice and she would insert garlic.  ??  She said it worked.  I've also heard of salt water baths.but I do really think it is time to see a doctor again.  good luck

question: Back ground: 48yrs, 3 grown children 2 sex partners in 25 yrs, chorionic vaginal yeast infections my whole adult life. Very healthy, no diabetes, no HIV, live very organic and natural, low sugar diet, eat yogurt 5 days a week. Some yrs,  at least 4 infections per yr. MOSTLY.......I have one on a monthly basis, either befor or after my period. Now that I'm peri menopausal they occur post intercourse. I stopped using over counter meds, now using natural remedies. I have not seen a dr for thus in yrs. I just don't think anyone will have an answer I havnt heard. Thank u
title: 30 years yeast infections
